general_advisory: Staking should be done in crops like maize (earthing up) and in fruit crops to prevent them from toppling. It is important to keep the rain water in the rice field to protect it from various diseases. Sheds of cattle and goats are made clean and provide fresh feeds and water. Feeding to fish should be in a regulated manner, if water seems cloudy then stop feeding for the day.

advisory: Collection and destruction of affected fruits.
Spray any one of the insecticides Azadirachtin 0.03% WSP (300 ppm) @ 5.0 g/lit, Buprofezin 70 DF @5.5 ml/10 lit, Quinalphos 25 % EC @ 8.0 ml/10 lit, Emamectin benzoate 5 % SG @3.0 g/10 lit.
Drain out excess of water after the rainfall.
Blast disease may occur due to alternate drying and wetting condition so it is necessary to keep standing water in rice field.
Spray Hexaconazole or Tricyclazole@0.7gram/ liter) at 15 days interval regularly.
Fusarium wilt is characterized by wilting of the plant and upward and inward rolling of the leaves
Uproot the infected plants and dispose it safely.
Drenching with 1% Bordeaux mixture or blue copper or Fytolan 0.25% may give protection.
Apply Tagmycin @ 1.5 packets and Neem oil @ 75 ml/15 liter of water as curative measures.
If the pond water looks cloudy then stop feeding the fish for the day and resume feeding again tomorrow.
